Detailed Description

ObitUVGrid class function definitions.

This class is derived from the Obit base class.

void ObitUVGridClear (  gpointer  inn  ) 
 

Private: Deallocate members.

Does (recursive) deallocation of parent class members. For some reason this wasn't build into the GType class.

Parameters:
inn Pointer to the object to deallocate. Actually it should be an ObitUVGrid* cast to an Obit*.

void ObitUVGridFFT2ImPar (  olong  nPar,
ObitUVGrid **  in,
ObitFArray **  array,
ObitErr *  err
) 
 

Public: Parallel FFT grid to image plane with gridding correction.

If Beams are being made, there should be entries in in and array for both beam and image with the beam immediately prior to the associated image. Apparently the threading in FFTW clashes with that in Obit so here the FFTs are done sequentially

Parameters:
nPar Number of parallel griddings
in Array of objects to grid
array Array of output image pixel arrays, elements must correspond to those in in
err ObitErr stack for reporting problems.

void ObitUVGridReadUV (  ObitUVGrid *  in,
ObitUV *  UVin,
ObitErr *  err
) 
 

Public: Read uv data accumulating to grid.

Buffering of data will use the buffers as defined on UVin ("nVisPIO" in info member). The UVin object will be closed at the termination of this routine. Requires setup by #ObitUVGridCreate. The gridding information should have been stored in the ObitInfoList on in:

  • "Guardband" OBIT_float scalar = maximum fraction of U or v range allowed in grid. Default = 0.4.
  • "MaxBaseline" OBIT_float scalar = maximum baseline length in wavelengths. Default = 1.0e15.
  • "startChann" OBIT_long scalar = first channel (1-rel) in uv data to grid. Default = 1.
  • "numberChann" OBIT_long scalar = number of channels in uv data to grid. Default = all.
    Parameters:
    in Object to initialize
    UVin Uv data object to be gridded. Should be the same as passed to previous call to ObitUVGridSetup for input in.
    err ObitErr stack for reporting problems.

void ObitUVGridReadUVPar (  olong  nPar,
ObitUVGrid **  in,
ObitUV **  UVin,
ObitErr *  err
) 
 

Public: Parallel read uv data accumulating to grid.

Buffering of data will use the buffers as defined on UVin ("nVisPIO" in info member). The UVin object will be closed at the termination of this routine. Requires setup by #ObitUVGridCreate. The gridding information should have been stored in the ObitInfoList on in[0]:

  • "Guardband" OBIT_float scalar = maximum fraction of U or v range allowed in grid. Default = 0.4.
  • "MaxBaseline" OBIT_float scalar = maximum baseline length in wavelengths. Default = 1.0e15.
  • "startChann" OBIT_long scalar = first channel (1-rel) in uv data to grid. Default = 1.
  • "numberChann" OBIT_long scalar = number of channels in uv data to grid. Default = all.
    Parameters:
    nPar Number of parallel griddings
    in Array of objects to grid Each should be initialized by ObitUVGridSetup To include beams, double nPar and set doBeam member on one of each pair.
    UVin Array of UV data objects to be gridded. Should be the same as passed to previous call to ObitUVGridSetup for input in element. MUST all point to same data set with same selection but possible different calibration. All but [0] should be closed.
    err ObitErr stack for reporting problems.

void ObitUVGridSetup (  ObitUVGrid *  in,
ObitUV *  UVin,
ObitImageDesc *  beamDesc,
ObitImageDesc *  imageDesc,
gboolean  doBeam,
ObitErr *  err
) 
 

Public: initialize/reset ObitUVGrid structures.

Input data should be fully edited and calibrated, with any weighting applied and converted to the appropriate Stokes type. The object UVin will be opened during this call if it is not already open. The output image should describe the center, size and grid spacing of the desired image. The beam corresponding to each image should be made first using the same ObitUVGrid.

Parameters:
in Object to initialize
UVin Uv data object to be gridded.
beamDesc Descriptor for beam to be derived.
imageDesc Descriptor for image to be derived.
doBeam TRUE is this is a Beam.
err ObitErr stack for reporting problems.
